title.narrative: CHILD AND GENDER SENSITIVE DISASTER RESI

description.narrative: Output 2.3: Child and gender sensitive disaster resilience and climate change adaptation plans and programmes institutionalized and operational at national and sub-national levels., which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2: Evidence generated for policy advocacy for inclusion in social services by 2020.

sector.narrative: Climate change/environmental education, awareness and advocacy
Ending violence against women and girls
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

title.narrative: Maldives United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Maldives (Climate Change and Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Maldives: Evaluability Assessment of UNICEF Maldives Country Programme 2016 - 2020
Maldives 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: Child and gender sensitive disaster resilience and climate change adaptation plans and programmes institutionalized and operational at national and sub-national levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its technical, financial and supply assistance to the National Disaster Management Authority to enable the national organization fulfill its responsibility of disaster/climate risk reduction and response to emergencies. UNICEF supported the mainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction and Climate Change Adaptation from a child and gender perspective by supporting the chapter on DRR and CCA of the new SAP and the relevant sectors of the Plan. At the community level, UNICEF trained 167 children and young people (99 girls/68 boys) as environmental advocates aiming to mobilize their peers and their communities on climate change and environmental protection issues. ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2019

title.narrative: National emergency response framework and action plan developed

actual.value: 2016:As requested by NDMC, the establishment of Community Emergency Response Teams (CERTs) as a key component of the NERF would be supported by UNICEF MCO instead. Conceptual framework needed to establish the CERTs is currently being developed with UNICEF's technical assistance.

title.narrative: Adolescents and young people from island communities engaged through physical or online learning sessions on climate change and environmental protection
Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) framework developed and operational
MCO Communication and Public Advocacy strategy developed and operational
Child and gender sensitive disaster risk planning activities conducted in 5 islands in Northern Maldives
